means: 掌打，拳打( cuff的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Brodie cuffed him on the side of the head.
sentence.Network_cn: 布罗迪拍了一下他的头。

sentence.Network_en: She cuffed the boy on the side of the head.
sentence.Network_cn: 她向这男孩的头上轻轻打了一巴掌.

sentence.Network_en: Mother cuffed the dog when she found it asleep on a chair.
sentence.Network_cn: 妈妈发现狗睡在椅子上就用手把狗打跑了.

they found her the next day cuffed to the bed., 第二天他们发现她被铐在床上.

entry.def: The cuffs of a shirt or dress are the parts at the ends of the sleeves, which are thicker than the rest of the sleeve.

example.ex: ...a pale blue shirt with white collar and cuffs.
example.tran: 有白色衣领和袖口的浅蓝色衬衫

entry.def: The cuffs on a pair of pants or trousers are the parts at the ends of the legs, which are folded up.

entry.tran: (通常指轻而快地)拍，击(头或耳部)
entry.def: If you cuff someone, you hit them quickly and lightly with your hand, usually on their head or their ear.

example.ex: Brodie cuffed him on the side of the head.
example.tran: 布罗迪拍了一下他的头。

entry.def: If the police cuff someone, they put handcuffs on them.

example.ex: She hoped they wouldn't cuff her hands behind her back.
example.tran: 她希望他们不要把她反铐起来。

entry.tran: 未经准备(或思考)的;即兴的
entry.def: An off-the-cuff remark is made without being prepared or thought about in advance.

example.ex: I didn't mean any offence. It was a flippant, off-the-cuff remark...
example.tran: 我并无冒犯之意。那只是随口说出的一句轻率话。

example.ex: Mr Baker was speaking off the cuff when he made those suggestions.
example.tran: 贝克先生临时提出那些建议。

means.word_mean: 1. struck with especially the open hand;

sentences.sentence: "hung his head like a cuffed and chastised child"
"wondered which was the worse punishment, her slapped face or her injured feelings"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: They were made to kneel, their cuffed hands behind their heads.

auth_sentence.content: The wind...did not clear the sky but cuffed the air this way and that.
auth_sentence.res_content: The wind...did not clear the sky but cuffed the air this way and that.
